article.title: Nucleon form factors in dispersively improved Chiral Effective Field Theory I: Scalar form factor

multiple_choice_question.text: What information does Figure 1 convey about the dispersive integrals for the scalar charge radius and the Cheng-Dashen discrepancy?
choices: The integrals diverge rapidly, with the main contribution coming from the region t\' > 0.5 GeV².
The integrals converge slowly, and contributions from all t\' are equally important.
The integrals converge rapidly, with the main contribution coming from the region t\' ≤ 0.5 GeV².
The figure does not provide information about the convergence of the integrals.

multiple_choice_question.text: What concept is illustrated in Figure 2(c)?
choices: The analytic structure of the pion scalar form factor.
The unitarity relation for the imaginary part of the nucleon scalar form factor on the two-pion cut, expressed in terms of J(t) and the squared modulus of the pion FF.
The Feynman diagrams contributing to the ππ → NÑ partial-wave amplitude at leading order in χEFT.
The relation between the ππ → NÑ partial-wave amplitude and the timelike pion form factor in the complex t plane.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Figure 5 illustrate regarding the contributions of the N and Δ Born terms to the quantity [3kcm/(4p√t)] J(t)?
choices: The contributions from the N and Δ Born terms have opposite signs and largely cancel each other.
The Δ Born term dominates over a wide range of t.
The contributions from the N and Δ Born terms have the same sign and are roughly comparable in magnitude.
The N Born term dominates over a wide range of t.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the normalized squared modulus of the pion scalar form factor reaching a value of ~3 at t ~ 0.3 GeV², as shown in Figure 7?
choices: It indicates the absence of ππ rescattering in this region.
It highlights the importance of including the KK channel in the calculation of the pion form factor.
It emphasizes the small size of the pion and the limited range of its interaction.
It indicates the presence of strong ππ rescattering in this region.
